source.description: Clean the OT-2.

source.title: Cleaning an OT-2 COVID-19 Diagnostic Station

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3gdan","text":"Wipe these parts of the OT-2 down with a 1:10 dilution of bleach:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"60uih","text":"The clear polycarbonate windows.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9o1cs","text":"The black pipette stems. (Avoid the rest of the pipettes, including the ejectors.)","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d87on","text":"The aluminum deck.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"45id7","text":"The removable black trash bin.","type":"ordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":5}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"84hp7","text":"Wait  , then quickly rinse the bleach off with distilled water.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1rdip","text":" ","type":"atomic"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6ot2n","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[{"data":{"duration":30,"guid":"C1B373A0715A11EA865A49396AE0797C","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"duration"},{"data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dn69a","text":"The aluminum on the OT-2 will be discolored if the bleach sits for too long. In the long term, it may also cause more serious corrosion.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"B95B3470716111EAAA59738053F1239B"},"mutability":"IMMUTABLE","type":"notes"}]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8okjl","text":"Wipe these parts of the OT-2 down with RNaseZap or RNase AWAY.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5m3c8","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"rqi5","text":"The same parts that you wiped down with bleach:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"38ku8","text":"The clear polycarbonate windows.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1ef4s","text":"The black pipette stems. (Avoid the rest of the pipettes, including the ejectors.)","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3ef8j","text":"The aluminum deck.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cktg8","text":"The removable black trash bin.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1llq3","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4ievb","text":"Plus these additional parts:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"31s89","text":"The bottoms of the pipette ejectors.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a8t23","text":"Any Temperature Modules or Magnetic Modules that the OT-2 has on its deck.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"34r69","text":"Any 96 well aluminum blocks that are going to be used on the OT-2.","type":"ordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8t1rp","text":"Rinse the RNaseZap or RNase AWAY off with distilled water.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8kisa","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d365p","text":"Wipe the OT-2 dry, or let the water evaporate.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"50i15","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

source.description:
Place the following labware on the OT-2's deck:
Slot 1: An Opentrons Temperature Module with an Opentrons 96 well aluminum block and an empty, sterile NEST 100 µL PCR plate.
Slots 3, 6, 7, 9, and 10: A full, sterile rack of Opentrons 200 µL filter tips.
Slot 4: An Opentrons Magnetic Module with nothing on it.
Slot 11: An empty NEST 1-well reservoir, for organic liquid waste.

Start pre-cooling the Temperature Module to
.

Wait for the Temperature Module to reach
.
Place the sample well plate in slot 4.
Place the reagent reservoir in slot 2.

Double-check all the labware to make sure it looks correct.
  • Check that labware are inserted the right way around (well A1 at the top-left for the plates, well 1 at the left for the troughs).
  • Check that labware are properly clicked into the deck slots.
  • Check the deck layout:
Run the Station B protocol on the OT-2. The protocol file should be StationB-48samples-Zymo.py.

source.title: Operating an OT-2 for COVID-19 testing

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":6,"style":"bold"}],"key":"arr68","text":"Click Start run. The OT-2 will home its motors and then begin the protocol.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a73jr","text":" ","type":"atomic"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eljid","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"13h1j","text":" ","type":"atomic"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bhsj4","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[{"data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":9,"offset":52}],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":13,"style":"bold"}],"key":"9gg5a","text":"Do not click Start run more than once. If you do, a known bug will make the OT-2 run the protocol back-to-back.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[{"data":{"guid":"DD0E6D00751311EA92166D3C9D29DB70","url":"https:\/\/github.com\/Opentrons\/opentrons\/issues\/5239"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"link"}],"guid":"B3149380751311EA92166D3C9D29DB70"},"mutability":"IMMUTABLE","type":"safety"},{"data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":59,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"c1arb","text":"If something goes wrong and you need to abort the protocol:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f2it","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3teoe","text":"Shut down the OT-2 with the power switch on its back left side.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1dssi","text":"Turn the OT-2 back on. Wait a couple of minutes for the pipettes to rise.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5gusq","text":"Manually remove any tips attached to the pipettes. (This ensures that the pipettes will not aspirate liquid into themselves when they home.)","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"19ej8","text":"Reconnect to the OT-2 in the Opentrons App. Click the Home button to move the gantry out of the way so you can access the labware on the deck.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1bhbm","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"4E7109F0751711EABA5DAF4A5985F9AC"},"mutability":"IMMUTABLE","type":"safety"}]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":46,"style":"bold"}],"key":"5nphj","text":"Ensure you are connected to the robot. In the Robots tab, you can try flipping the robot's lights on and off to test the connection.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":3,"offset":10,"style":"bold"}],"key":"dbem5","text":"Go to the Run tab.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4k1s9","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8uij0","text":"Double-check the name at the top to make sure the correct protocol is uploaded.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

The output is the NEST 100 µL PCR plate sitting on the aluminum block atop the Temperature Module in slot 1.

Prepare the reagent reservoir.
Into a 15 mL NEST 12 well reservoir, pipette or pour the following reagents:
Well 1:
Well 2:
Well 3:
Well 4:
Well 5:
Well 6:

source.body: This step is time-sensitive. The MagBinding Beads will slowly settle in the Viral DNA/RNA Buffer. Continue quickly until you start the run on the OT-2. Vortex the Viral DNA/RNA Buffer + MagBinding Beads immediately before adding them to the reservoir.

source.description:
Prepare 3x
...

In a sterile 15 mL tube, add
.
Vortex the MagBinding Beads in their container.

Pipe
to the 15 mL tube.

Repeat for a total of 3x
.

Prepare the sample well plate.
The sample well plate is a NEST 96 deep well plate.
The 48 samples (#1–#48) should be laid out like this:

Wait for the run to finish. It should take 2.5–3 hours.
